column4: how do i write a /bin/sh function that takes a file and does a sed replace on it?

not sure, but perhaps you're looking for  /usr/bin/rename.ul
bah, that's probably not it
ok.. ill try it it
yeah, worth a look i guess
What does it mean?
means that /usr/bin/rename was installed by some script that came in package is my guess, and not by an actual package
and of course, i would guess it would be a perl script
i let out *not*
means that /usr/bin/rename was *not* installed by some script that came in package is my guess, and not by an actual package
nvm, i had it right the first time. i think it's bedtime for me, lol
greezmunkey: ls -l /usr/bin/rename  -->  /usr/bin/rename -> /etc/alternatives/rename
greezmunkey: ls -l /etc/alternatives/rename -> /usr/bin/prename
